post.summary: Set presence on all tickets within participation
post.description: This action endpoint requires valid `status_presence` data as payload. Optionally, both `participation_certificates_credits_override` and `participation_certificates_date_override` are accepted.

- Depending on the selected ticket types, `addressee` and e-mail are `required`. They can be omitted if `member_id` is given.
 - `member_id` is required for tickets with `visibility_level=members|members_filter` and should be omitted for tickets with the `visibility_level=external_only`
 - The invoice properties are required when the event has `participation_billing_enabled=True`.
 - `remarks` can be submitted when the event has `participant_remarks_enabled=True`, otherwise they are not editable in the manager
 - When an event has `participation_information_collection_type=ticket`, `name`  and `email` is required per ticket.

x-codeSamples.source:
import requests

headers = {'Authorization': 'Bearer {api_access_key}'}
params = {}
url = 'https://api.congressus.nl/v30/members/<int:member_id>/logs'

resp = requests.get(url, params=params, headers=headers)
resp.raise_for_status()

result = resp.json()
data = result['data']

post.description: Create a log entry. This is only possible for log entries of type `note` or `task`.

put.description:
## Update a log entry

### Limitations:
This is only possible for log entries of type `note` or `task`.

### Updating simple fields:
For notes, only the `text` field can be updated. For tasks, it's also possible to update the assignee through the
`assignee_type` and `assignee_id` fields.

### Marking tasks as completed:
Tasks can also be marked as complete by setting `is_completed` to true and
optionally setting `completed_by_id` to the ID of the user that completed the task. If `completed_by_id` is not set,
the current user will be used.

delete.description: Delete a log entry. This is only possible for log entries of type `note` or `task`.

get.description:
By passing the `context` query filter
each row is filtered according to the context derived by there status.
This means that each row will only contain the fields that are set to visible or higher.
The settings for each context can be found in the manager: https://manager.congressus.nl/settings/statuses

tags.name: Background processes
tags.description: Background processes are used for async tasks, e.g. sending mailings and creating downloadable exports of information from Congressus.

tags.name: Bank mutations
tags.description:
BankMutation objects represent mutations in the bank account of an association

## Data model
- **BankMutation** - Main object, representing a mutation
- **BankStatement** - Statement on which one or more mutations are collected
- **BankImport** - Import of one or more bank statements in one or more CAMT.053-files

tags.name: Blogs
tags.description:
Blogs are used for a the publication of articles on the website(s) of an association.

## Data model
- **Blog** - Base model for blogs, which functions as a container for BlogParagraph objects.
- **BlogParagraph** - Content of a Blog. A blog consists of one or more BlogParagraphs.
  - BlogTextParagraph
  - BlogImageParagraph
- **BlogCategory** - Defines category and basic publication settings for the associated blogs. Each blog has exactly 
one category.
- **BlogIssue** - Defines an issue to which a Blog is linked. Optional.
- **BlogAuthor** - Defines the author of a Blog. Optional.

> Keep published set to False as long you do not want to share your blog with the outside world. 
After the creation of the Blog object you can start filling the blog with either text (BlogTextParagraph) or 
images (BlogImageParagraph).

> The content of an blog (list of BlogParagraphs) is returned withing the get blogs/<obj_id> endpoint. 
The /blogs list view does not contain them.

## Uploading images
Images are saved in the form of a StorageObject. Create a StorageObject first before you create a BlogImageParagraph.

tags.name: Career partners
tags.description:
Career partners are used as a special kind of organisation. They are used to display a list of partners, e.g. on the
website. Career partners are grouped into categories. Each partner has exactly one category.

## Data model
- **CareerPartner**.
- **CareerPartnerCategory** - Defines category and basic publication settings for the associated partners.

tags.name: Communication
tags.description: Communication

tags.name: Countries
tags.description: Countries are used to define the countries and their specifics that are available within Congressus.

tags.name: EditorJS
tags.description: File upload endpoints for editor-js.

tags.name: Event categories
tags.description: Event categories

tags.name: Events
tags.description:
Events are used for a the publication of events on the website(s) of an association. When enabled, both 
members and/or external persons can sign up for an event.

Sign up has multiple modes; `registration` for single ticket registrations for an event and `ticketing` for more
complex sign up with the option to select one or more tickets per participation.

Billing and payment is defined by the sign up settings too.
- When `participation_billing_enabled`, the `participation_billing_type` defines if an invoice is send direct or later.
- The `participation_payment_<xx>` options define the available payment methods when participation_billing_enabled and 
participation_billing_type is set to direct.

## Data model
- **Event** - Base model for events
- **EventCategory** - Defines category and basic publication settings for the associated events. Each event has exactly 
one category.
- **EventTicketType** - Ticket type available for an event
- **EventParticipation** - Participation with one or more sold tickets
- **EventParticipationTicket** - Ticket sold for an event to a member or non-member

tags.name: Galleries
tags.description: Photo galleries

tags.name: Group folders
tags.description: Group folders

tags.name: Groups
tags.description:
Groups are a collection of Members e.g. a Board, Committee, etc.

## Data model
- **Group**.
- **GroupFolder** - Organize Groups in a folder-like structure.
- **GroupMembership** - Relate members to a group.

tags.name: Logs
tags.description: Logs are used to track user activity within Congressus.

tags.name: Member statuses
tags.description:
## Member statuses

We do provide a list with all member statuses. These statuses have different types:
- Active member status - contains members that have the ability to log in at the website(s) of the association
- Archived member status - contains archived members. Complete profiles are available within Congressus Manager, but archived members are not able te log in at any website.

Special cases:
- Hidden member status - former member statuses, not currently in use in the administration. These are hidden from many places, but history is preserved.
- Deceased member status - contains archived members who have passed away. This feature is only available for our Enterprise plan.

tags.name: Members
tags.description:
## Data model
- **Member** - Main object, representing the member
- **MembershipStatus** - Represents the status of a Member at a given period defined by `member_from` and optional
`member_to` datetimes.


## Membership statuses
Congressus tracks the MemberStatus of a member over time. Each member has exactly one MemberStatus at each given
moment in time. The current MemberStatus is derived from the MembershipStatus model, which has a `member_from` and an
optional `member_to` datetime.

All operations on the status of the membership are done through the `/member/<obj_id>/statuses` resources. These
resources make sure that MembershipStatuses do not overlap. **~~These resources are currently not implemented.~~
These resources are available as of June 28th, 2022.**

### Member statuses
We do provide a list with all Member statuses. These statuses have different types:
- Active member status - contains members that have the ability to log in at the website(s) of the association
- Archived member status - contains archived members. Complete profiles are available within Congressus Manager, but archived members are not able te log in at any website.

Special cases:
- Hidden member status - former member statuses, not currently in use in the administration. These are hidden from many places, but history is preserved.
- Deceased member status - contains archived members who have passed away. This feature is only available for our Enterprise plan.


## Name of a member
The name of a person is quite an extensive part within the Member-object. Congressus registers a list with
name-attributes. Depending on the choices of the assocation, not all attributes are used. Based on the attributes, we
also render a list of derived name properties.

Attributes of a name - can be set using the API:
- `initials` - Initials of the member
- `given_name` - Given name of the member
- `first_name` - Full list of first names
- `primary_last_name_main` - Main part of the last name
- `primary_last_name_prefix` - Additional part of the last name (e.g. 'van der', 'von', etc.)
- `secondary_last_name_main`- Main part of an additional last name (e.g. maiden name)
- `secondary_last_name_prefix` - Additional part of the secondary last name (e.g. 'van der', 'von', etc.)
- `last_name_display` - Sets which last names are used in day-to-day communication by the member.
- `prefix` - e.g. 'Prof. dr.'
- `suffix` - e.g. 'MSc.'

Properties - based on name attributes:
- `last_name` - combination of all *_last_name_* fields, rendered according to the 'last_name_display' attribute
- `primary_last_name` - combination of all primary_last_name_* fields
- `secondary_last_name` - combination of all secondary_last_name_* fields

## Context for validation

Validation could be extended with a context. This context defines which fields are available, editable and required for
a certain member. This context is set per MemberStatus from within Congressus Manager (settings > member statuses).

Adding the context-parameter to a request ensures that only the fields within that context could be read and updated.
There are six different contexts available:
1. `sign_up` - context for the online sign-up on the website of the association
2. `profile_activate` - context for activating the personal account on the website of the association
3. `profile_edit` - context for editing the personal profile via the website of the association
4. `almanac` - context for showing data in the member list / almanac on the website. This context has no editable fields.
5. `manager_add` - context used when adding new members via Congressus Manager
5. `manager_edit` - context used when editing members via Congressus Manager


## Custom fields
Within Congressus, custom fields could be added to the member profiles. These custom fields are added as a list
attribute of the Member-object.

Custom fields could handle a large amount of different data types, which makes validation tricky.

Custom field types currently supported:

- `text_long` - String, single line with a max length of 255 characters
  - `email` - String, valid email addresses only
  - `url` - String, valid URL's only
- `text_multi` - Multi line text field

- `datetime` - Date and time. In UTC.
- `date` - Date only

- `number` - Integer value
- `decimal` - Decimal value
  - `euro` - Decimal value, rendered with two decimal places

- `checkbox` - Boolean value, rendered as a checkbox, null is interpreted as False
- `yes_no` - Boolean value, rendered as a yes / no field, null is interpreted as No

- `option` - Dropdown list, only one option could be selected
  - `option_radio` - Same as option, but presented in the web interface as radio fields

- `option_multiple` - Dropdown list in which multiple options could be selected
  - `option_multiple_checkbox` - Same as option_multiple, but presented in the web interface as checkboxes

- `address` - Address with separate fields for address, zip, city and country.
- `phonenumber` - Phone number with separate fields for number and country (calling code).

- `education_study_duo` - Option field with an opinionated list of studies in The Netherlands.

- `storage_object` - Relation with a storage object, see the Storage objects documentation for more information.

tags.name: News
tags.description: News

tags.name: Notifications
tags.description: Notifications

tags.name: Organisations
tags.description:
Organisations are used as a special kind of group. Organisations have a profile which can be published on the website. 
Members can be related to the Organisation, for example as employees or owners of the Organisation.

## Data model
- **Organisation**.
- **OrganisationCategory** - Defines category and basic publication settings for the associated organisations. Each 
organisation has exactly one category.

tags.name: Pricing
tags.description: Pricing information for our marketing website.

tags.name: Product folders
tags.description: Product folders

tags.name: Products
tags.description: Products are used for invoices. Congressus creates products automatically for event tickets, planning and rental.

tags.name: Sale invoices
tags.description:
SaleInvoice objects represent a sale invoice

## Data model
- **SaleInvoice** - Main object, representing a sale invoice
- **SaleInvoiceItem** - Row on a sale invoice with information about the invoiced Product (goods, products or services)
- **SaleInvoicePayment** - Payment related to a sale invoice

## Sale invoice workflows
All communication, default delivery methods, payment conditions and due intervals for a sale invoice are defined by the 
sale invoice workflow attached to the sale invoice.

## Invoice status
The invoice status is managed and could not be set manually. The invoice_status attribute has one of the following 
statuses:
- `concept` - The sale invoice is created but not yet sent
- `open` - The sale invoice is sent to the debtor, not yet paid and not due
- `late` - According to the workflow, this sale invoice is due
- `reminded` - A reminder is send to the debtor after the sale invoice was late
- `paid` - The sale invoice is fully paid
- `pending_payment` - Status used when the invoice is in a direct debit batch (to be collected) or active 
iDeal-transaction
- `uncollectible` - Status used when the debtor is not expected to be able to pay the invoice at any moment


## Invoice actions
The invoice status changes when certain actions are triggered. Some actions are automatic or triggered by other actions,
such as marking sale invoices late (due) and when a payment is initiated (pending).

Other actions are triggered manually, and these actions are also available in the API:
- send
- remind
- mark-uncollectible
- mark-collectible

Our API always inherits the status flow, shown in the flowchart below:
![SaleInvoice status flow with actions](https://congressus-static.s3-eu-west-1.amazonaws.com/api-docs/v30/saleinvoice_status_flowchart.png)

tags.name: Storage
tags.description: General layer for file storage objects like images and documents

tags.name: Webhooks
tags.description:
Webhooks are useful in a broad range of situations. When the state of an object changes, Congressus will perform a 
HTTP request to the URL you provide. Based on the payload of the request, you can determine which action you need to 
perform.

You can read more about webhooks at Congressus in the special section about Webhooks at the top of our API 
documentation.

tags.name: Webpages
tags.description:
Webpage objects represent a webpage on a Website

## Data model 
- **Webpage** - Pages linked to a Website. Have a parent/child relationship, so we can build a nice tree of Webpages
- **ContentRow** - A webpage has one or more rows for with content (see remarks).
- **ContentItem** - Section with content. Has a `size` which defines if the content has to be shown full width or not.


## Content rows
At this moment each Webpage has exactly one row with content. We plan to support multiple rows and row types in the 
future e.g. CTA rows, rows with different background, etc.

The only additional information for content rows at this moment is the `order`. This order defaults to 1.


## Content items
A generic type, returning the content for a section of content shown on the webpage. We expect to expand on the 
different content types in future updates of this API.

tags.name: Websites
tags.description:
Website objects represent a website

## Data model
- **Website** - Website including properties as language and URL 
- **Webpage** - Pages linked to a Website. Have a parent/child relationship, so we can build a nice tree of Webpages

status.description: Match status for all mutations within this import

sdd_reason_code.description: Reason code for reversed SEPA direct debit payments, only relevant when `is_sdd = true`

sdd_reason_code_description.description: Human readable information on the sdd_reason_code, only relevant when `is_sdd = true`

amount.description: Amount to match. When empty, the unpaid amount for the sale invoice is used.

published.description: True when this blog is published on the website

visibility.description: Visibility level set for this blog

authentication_required.description: True when only authenticated users are allowed to view this blog

published.description: True when this blog is published on the website

visibility.description: Visibility level set for this blog

authentication_required.description: True when only authenticated users are allowed to view this blog

color.description: Color for this category. A valid hex value is required. Default color is used when left blank.

status.description: Status for participating at this event

published.description: True when this event is published on the website

visibility.description: Visibility level set for this event

authentication_required.description: True when only authenticated users are allowed to view this event

num_tickets.description: Capacity for this event. Null means no capacity limit.

num_tickets_sold.description: Number of tickets that are sold for this event

website_url.description: URL for this event on the website. If the association has multiple websites, the first available website on which this event is published, is used.

website_subscribe_url.description: URL on the website to subscribe for this event. If the association has multiple websites, the first available website on which this event is published, is used.

slug.description: Slug for this partner, used for navigation on the website

description.description: Description for this partner. HTML is allowed.

description_short.description: Brief description for this partner. No HTML allowed.

invoice_addressee_attention.description: Invoice addressee attention for this organisation

invoice_address_field.description: Invoice address field for this organisation

invoice_email.description: Invoice email address for this organisation. Leave empty to use the general email address.

color.description: Color for this category. A valid hex value is required. Default color is used when left blank.

published.description: Set the publication of objects in this category.

visibility.description: Set the visibility of objects in this category.

availability_status.description: Status for the availability of this ticket type. Ticket types with status "available", "limited" and "waiting list" are available for new participants.

confirmation_email_text.description: Additional text added to the confirmation email for participants. Only added when the corresponding boolean is set to True

confirmation_email_text_enabled.description: True when an additional text has to be added to the confirmation email for participants

description.description: Optional description for this ticket type

num_tickets.description: Max. number of tickets that could be sold for this ticket type

num_tickets_sold.description: Number of tickets that are sold for this ticket type

price.description: Price for this ticket. Set to 0 to show _free_, set to null to hide price.

participation_certificate_credits.description: Number of credits for the participation certificate. Set to 0 to disable certificate. Set to null to use the default value from the event.

color.description: Color for this category. A valid hex value is required. Default color is used when left blank.

slug.description: Slug for this partner, used for navigation on the website

description.description: Description for this partner. HTML is allowed.

description_short.description: Brief description for this partner. No HTML allowed.

invoice_addressee_attention.description: Invoice addressee attention for this organisation

invoice_address_field.description: Invoice address field for this organisation

invoice_email.description: Invoice email address for this organisation. Leave empty to use the general email address.

status.description: Status for participating at this event

published.description: True when this event is published on the website

visibility.description: Visibility level set for this event

authentication_required.description: True when only authenticated users are allowed to view this event

participation_enabled.description: Enable sign up for this event

participation_mode.description: Participation mode for this event. Use `"single"` for registration (one ticket) or `"ticketing"` for multiple tickets per participation.

participation_billing_enabled.description: Enable billing for this event. When enabled, Congressus will handle invoicing and payments.

participation_billing_type.description: Define if the participant is billed direct or later. When set to `"later"`, it is possible to update prices after the event, before invoices are sent.

participation_information_collection_typ.description: Define if name and email is required per participation or per ticket.

qr_ticketing_enabled.description: When enabled, Congressus generates tickets with a QR code which could be used to scan tickets at the door of the event. _Please note: additional charges apply for QR tickets_

num_tickets.description: Capacity for this event. Null means no capacity limit.

num_tickets_sold.description: Number of tickets that are sold for this event

num_tickets_max_per_order.description: Max. number of tickets that can be ordered at once. Only relevant for participation_mode=`"ticketing"`.

participant_remarks_enabled.description: Enables participants to add remarks to their order

participant_remarks_placeholder.description: Placeholder text for the participant remarks. Could be used for questions etc.

rental_enabled.description: Enables rental for participants. Only available when module rental is enabled.

rental_categories.description: Rental categories from which participants can rent items

rental_max_price.description: Max. rental price per participation. When set to null, no limit is used.

website_url.description: URL for this event on the website. If the association has multiple websites, the first available website on which this event is published, is used.

website_subscribe_url.description: URL on the website to subscribe for this event. If the association has multiple websites, the first available website on which this event is published, is used.

num_tickets_sold.description: Number of tickets sold for this participation

status.description: Status for this participation. You can update this status with action endpoints.

remarks.description: Remarks added by the participant during order

participation_certificates_credits_overr.description: Number of credits for the participation certificate. Set to 0 to disable certificate. Set to null to use the default value from the event.

participation_certificates_date_override.description: Date override for the participation certificate. Set to null to use the default value from the event.

archived.description: Archived memberships are not able to log in on the website(s)

deceased.description: Flag for deceased members, only available in our Enterprise plan

status_presence.description: Status for the presence of this participation.

product_offer_id.description: id of the product offer (variant) for this item

quantity.description: quantity of the item, default is 1

price.description: price for a single item, default is the price of the product offer

entity_id.description: ID of the entity to use for this sale invoice.

invoice_status.description: Status of the sale invoice. Follows the workflow. Cannot be set directly; use actions `send`, `remind` and `pay` instead.

collection_id.description: ID of the collection (Group / Organisation) to which this sale invoice is addressed. Optional.

contribution_start.description: Set a contribution start date when this invoice contains contribution.

contribution_end.description: Set a contribution end date when this invoice contains contribution for a given period.

use_direct_debit.description: Set to true to use direct debit to collect this sale invoice. Take care: this value is normally set automatically when the associated member has a valid direct debit mandate, the workflow has direct debit enabled and the association has a valid direct debit contract with the bank.

invoice_workflow_id.description: ID for the sale invoice workflow for this sale invoice. When omitted, the default workflow for the API is used.

addressee.description: Required when collection_id and member_id are omitted.

addressee_attention.description: Attention of the addressee, commonly used when the addressee is a company.

num_tickets_sold.description: Number of tickets sold for this participation

status.description: Status for this participation. You can update this status with action endpoints.

remarks.description: Remarks added by the participant during order

participation_certificates_credits_overr.description: Number of credits for the participation certificate. Set to 0 to disable certificate. Set to null to use the default value from the event.

participation_certificates_date_override.description: Date override for the participation certificate. Set to null to use the default value from the event.

status_presence.description: Status for the presence of all tickets in this participation.

participation_certificates_credits_overr.description: Number of credits for the participation certificate. Set to 0 to disable certificate. Set to null to use the default value from the event.

participation_certificates_date_override.description: Date override for the participation certificate. Set to null to use the default value from the event.
